questions.question_text: A technician receives a smartphone that has been experiencing screen-related issues. The display is barely visible, and the battery indicates the charge level is very low. The technician connects the device to a power source, but the screen remains dim. Which of the following should the technician perform FIRST to resolve the issue?

choices.D: Remove and reinsert the smartphone's battery.
choices.B: Reset the smartphone to factory settings.
choices.A: Enable airplane mode on the smartphone.

discussion.content:
Correct answer is: - A because here user is trying to transfer from a different OS so let's consider it as an android to ios

Can you transfer contacts from Gmail to iPhone?
Open the Settings app, scroll down and tap Accounts & Passwords (or Mail, Contacts, Calendars in some older versions of iOS), then add your Gmail account. Make sure Contacts are enabled for the account. You should now find that, after a few minutes, all of your Google contacts are in your iPhone.

questions.question_text:
Joe, a user, has purchased a new mobile device that uses a different OS than his previous one. Joe wants to copy his contacts and appointments from his corporate account without entering them manually.
Which of the following would be the BEST way for a technician to assist Joe?

choices.B: Create a Bluetooth connection between Joe's devices, and copy his contacts and calendar.
choices.C: Back up the old mobile device to a PC, and import the contacts and schedule from the PC.
choices.A: Log into the same email provider on the new device, and restore the contacts and dates.
choices.D: Use NFC to transfer all compatible data from one device to the other.

questions.question_text:
Ann, a user, asks a technician to configure her mobile phone for various sync capabilities. Ann wants to use her work email account on the phone everywhere she goes. She also would like the ability to connect her phone to her work vehicle for audio. Which of the following technologies would BEST meet Ann's needs?
(Choose two.)

choices.A: The microSD card is not formatted
choices.B: The microSD card is not a Class 10 device
choices.C: The system's OS is not updated

discussion.content:
If the MicroSD card is brand new then there is no formatting required. Simply put it in your device and it will be usable from the word go. If the device needs to do anything it will most likely prompt you or format itself automatically or when you first save an item to it.

If the card has been used previously (we'd recommend taking a copy of anything that might be saved on it you want to keep before using it in your phone) or you bought a used online, then you might want to consider formatting it to erase anything that might be on it. I

comments.content: This is not always true. While all drives are formatted, they may not have the proper formatting for the device you are attempting to use. Example: I recently bought a USB flash drive for my vehicles head unit. The drive came with an exFAT format by default but I needed NTFS.

All drives need a "format" to be recognized by a device. When you open Disk Manager, you can format a drive by right clicking it; Be careful as you will delete everything on the drive when formatting.
